result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Alan Farvour was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy Alan Farvour

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy Alan Farvour
Current: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 03-11-2016)
Prior: 430 E. Division St, C/O Waushara County Jail, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States
to Atty Selsing dated February 1, 2016
from Atty John Selsing dated January 27, 2016

2:04 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - are ready for a plea & sentencing today.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to count 2 as domestic, will dismiss the repeater and dismiss and read-in counts 1 & 3 & 4.  Atty Selsing concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as domestic.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 as domestic, strikes the repeater and orders counts 1,3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Selsing.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-45 days county jail, with huber and concurrent to any other sentence the is serving.  Out of county service.
-Court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit of 23 days.

Court orders the $500 cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.

Court adjourned at 2:13 p.m.
Waushara County Jail - 12/22/2015 at 1:30 p.m. (Plea & Sentencing)
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-22-2015 02:00 pm
State's

No Contact with Julie R.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

2:38 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court questions defendant regarding employment.  Court sets bond at $500.00 cash bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Julie R.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on September 28, 2015 at 11:45 a.m.
